event.title: took its name from the Battle of Waterloo in 1815

data.event: Waterloo took its name from the Battle of Waterloo in 1815, when Allied and Prussian forces under the Duke of Wellington and Bl√ºcher defeated the French forces under Napoleon Bonaparte.

event.title: had been granted 1,400 acres (5.7 km2) of land in 1823

data.event: William Hutchinson, superindendent of convicts and public works, had been granted 1,400 acres (5.7 km2) of land in 1823.
